API Reference

Core Interfaces

Grami AI Core Interfaces Module

This module defines the core protocols and abstract base classes for the Grami AI framework. It provides the foundational interfaces for: - Async Tools - Memory Management - LLM Integration - Agent Implementation - Kafka Integration - Prompt Engineering

These interfaces ensure consistent behavior and interoperability across the framework.

class grami_ai.core.interfaces.AsyncKafkaIntegration(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Protocol

Protocol for asynchronous Kafka message handling.

Provides a standardized interface for producing and consuming messages with Apache Kafka, enabling event-driven architectures.

async consume(topic: str) → AsyncIterator[Any][source]

Consume messages from a Kafka topic asynchronously.

Parameters:

topic (str) – Source Kafka topic.

Returns:

Iterator over consumed messages.

Return type:

AsyncIterator[Any]

async produce(topic: str, message: Any) → None[source]

Produce a message to a Kafka topic asynchronously.

Parameters:

  • topic (str) – Target Kafka topic.

  • message (Any) – Message to produce.

class grami_ai.core.interfaces.AsyncMemoryProvider(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Protocol, Generic[T]

Protocol for asynchronous memory management.

Provides a standardized interface for storing, retrieving, and managing data in memory systems. Supports generic type T for flexible data storage.

Type Parameters:

T: The type of values stored in memory.

async delete(key: str) → None[source]

Delete a value from memory asynchronously.

Parameters:

key (str) – Key of the value to delete.

async list_keys() → List[str][source]

List all keys in memory asynchronously.

Returns:

List of all keys currently in memory.

Return type:

List[str]

async retrieve(key: str) → T | None[source]

Retrieve a value from memory asynchronously.

Parameters:

key (str) – Key of the value to retrieve.

Returns:

Retrieved value if found, None otherwise.

Return type:

Optional[T]

async store(key: str, value: T) → None[source]

Store a value in memory asynchronously.

Parameters:

  • key (str) – Unique identifier for the stored value.

  • value (T) – Value to store.

class grami_ai.core.interfaces.AsyncTool(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Protocol

Protocol defining the interface for asynchronous tools usable by agents.

All tools in the framework must implement this protocol to ensure consistent behavior and interoperability with agents.

async execute(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any) → Any[source]

Execute the tool asynchronously.

Parameters:

  • *args – Variable positional arguments for tool execution.

  • **kwargs – Variable keyword arguments for tool execution.

Returns:

Result of tool execution.

Return type:

Any

Bases: ABC, Generic[T]

Advanced abstract base class for async agents.

Provides a comprehensive framework for building intelligent agents with support for LLMs, memory, tools, and messaging.

class grami_ai.core.interfaces.BaseLLMProvider[source]

Bases: ABC, Generic[T]

Enhanced abstract base class for LLM providers.

Provides a comprehensive interface for language model integration with support for tools, memory, and messaging.

Type Parameters:

T: The type of generation output.

abstract async generate(prompt: PromptTemplate, tools: List[AsyncTool] | None = None, memory: AsyncMemoryProvider | None = None, kafka_integration: AsyncKafkaIntegration | None = None, **kwargs: Any) → T[source]

Generate content using the language model.

Comprehensive generation method supporting: - Customizable prompts - Tool integration - Memory management - Kafka messaging

Parameters:

  • prompt (PromptTemplate) – Template for generation.

  • tools (Optional[List[AsyncTool]]) – Available tools.

  • memory (Optional[AsyncMemoryProvider]) – Memory provider.

  • kafka_integration (Optional[AsyncKafkaIntegration]) – Kafka integration.

  • **kwargs – Additional generation parameters.

Returns:

Generated content.

Return type:

T

Memory Management

Grami AI Memory Management Module

This module provides the core memory management functionality for the Grami AI framework. It includes abstract interfaces and concrete implementations for storing and managing conversation histories, agent states, and other persistent data.

Key Features: - Abstract memory interface - In-memory implementation - Async operations - Conversation management - Type-safe storage

Example

`python memory = InMemoryAbstractMemory() await memory.add_item("conv1", {"role": "user", "content": "Hello"}) items = await memory.get_items("conv1") `

class grami_ai.memory.memory.AbstractMemory[source]

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for memory management in AI agents.

Defines the core interface for storing and retrieving conversation history and other persistent data in the Grami AI framework. This class ensures consistent memory management across different implementations.

All memory implementations must provide: - Async operations - Conversation-based storage - Clear memory management

Example

```python class CustomMemory(AbstractMemory):

async def add_item(self, conversation_id, item):

# Custom implementation pass

```

abstract async add_item(conversation_id: str, item: Dict[str, Any]) → None[source]

Add an item to the memory for a specific conversation.

This method should be implemented to store conversation items in a way that maintains order and allows for efficient retrieval.

Parameters:

  • conversation_id (str) – Unique identifier for the conversation. Should be consistent across related operations.

  • item (Dict[str, Any]) – Item to be stored in memory. Typically contains ‘role’ and ‘content’ keys.

Raises:

  • ValueError – If the item format is invalid.

  • RuntimeError – If storage operation fails.

abstract async clear_conversation(conversation_id: str) → None[source]

Clear all items for a specific conversation.

This operation is irreversible. Use with caution.

Parameters:

conversation_id (str) – Unique identifier for the conversation.

Raises:

RuntimeError – If clear operation fails.

abstract async get_items(conversation_id: str) → List[Dict[str, Any]][source]

Retrieve all items for a specific conversation.

Returns items in chronological order (oldest first). If no items exist for the conversation, returns an empty list.

Parameters:

conversation_id (str) – Unique identifier for the conversation.

Returns:

List of conversation items.

Each item is a dictionary containing at least: - role: str (e.g., “user”, “assistant”) - content: str

Return type:

List[Dict[str, Any]]

Raises:

RuntimeError – If retrieval operation fails.

class grami_ai.memory.memory.InMemoryAbstractMemory[source]

Bases: AbstractMemory

In-memory implementation of AbstractMemory.

Provides a lightweight, dictionary-based storage solution suitable for: - Development and testing - Short-lived applications - Prototype deployments

Note

This implementation stores all data in memory and is not persistent across application restarts. For production use with persistence requirements, consider using a database-backed implementation.

_memory

Internal storage dictionary. Keys are conversation IDs, values are lists of conversation items.

Type:

Dict[str, List[Dict[str, Any]]]

async add_item(conversation_id: str, item: Dict[str, Any]) → None[source]

Add an item to the memory for a specific conversation.

Creates a new conversation list if the ID doesn’t exist. Thread-safe for concurrent access.

Parameters:

  • conversation_id (str) – Unique identifier for the conversation.

  • item (Dict[str, Any]) – Item to be stored in memory. Must contain ‘role’ and ‘content’ keys.

Raises:

ValueError – If item lacks required keys.

async clear_conversation(conversation_id: str) → None[source]

Clear all items for a specific conversation.

Silently ignores non-existent conversation IDs.

Parameters:

conversation_id (str) – Unique identifier for the conversation.

async get_items(conversation_id: str) → List[Dict[str, Any]][source]

Retrieve all items for a specific conversation.

Returns a shallow copy of the items list to prevent external modifications to internal storage.

Parameters:

conversation_id (str) – Unique identifier for the conversation.

Returns:

List of conversation items in chronological order.

Return type:

List[Dict[str, Any]]

Tools

Base Tools

Grami AI Base Tools Module

This module provides foundational async tools for the Grami AI framework, offering a comprehensive set of utility functions and base classes for building intelligent, asynchronous AI agents.

Key Features: - Async tool base classes - Flexible tool design - Comprehensive error handling - Modular architecture

class grami_ai.tools.base_tools.BaseTool(name: str, description: str, logger: Logger | None = None)[source]

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for all Grami AI tools.

Provides a standardized interface for async tool implementation, ensuring consistent behavior across different tool types.

name

Unique identifier for the tool.

Type:

str

description

Human-readable description of the tool’s purpose.

Type:

str

logger

Logging instance for the tool.

Type:

logging.Logger

abstract async run(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any) → Any[source]

Abstract method to execute the tool’s primary functionality.

Must be implemented by all subclasses to define the tool’s core logic.

Parameters:

  • *args – Variable positional arguments.

  • **kwargs – Variable keyword arguments.

Returns:

Result of the tool’s execution.

Return type:

Any

Raises:

NotImplementedError – If not implemented by subclass.

async validate_input(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any) → bool[source]

Validate input parameters before tool execution.

Provides a hook for input validation and preprocessing.

Parameters:

  • *args – Variable positional arguments to validate.

  • **kwargs – Variable keyword arguments to validate.

Returns:

True if input is valid, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

class grami_ai.tools.base_tools.CalculatorTool[source]

Bases: BaseTool

A specialized async calculator tool for mathematical operations.

Supports basic arithmetic operations with comprehensive error handling and logging.

Inherits all attributes from BaseTool.
async run(operation: str, a: int | float, b: int | float) → int | float[source]

Perform a mathematical operation asynchronously.

Parameters:

  • operation (str) – Mathematical operation to perform. Supported: ‘add’, ‘subtract’, ‘multiply’, ‘divide’

  • a (Union[int, float]) – First operand.

  • b (Union[int, float]) – Second operand.

Returns:

Result of the calculation.

Return type:

Union[int, float]

Raises:

ValueError – For invalid operations or division by zero.

async validate_input(operation: str, a: int | float, b: int | float) → bool[source]

Validate calculator input parameters.

Parameters:

  • operation (str) – Mathematical operation.

  • a (Union[int, float]) – First operand.

  • b (Union[int, float]) – Second operand.

Returns:

True if inputs are valid, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

class grami_ai.tools.base_tools.JSONParserTool[source]

Bases: BaseTool

Async JSON parsing and manipulation tool

Supports: - JSON parsing - JSON validation - JSON transformation

async run(json_data: str, operation: str = 'parse', **kwargs: Any) → Any[source]

Async JSON processing method

Parameters:

  • json_data – JSON string to process

  • operation – Processing operation (parse, validate, transform)

  • **kwargs – Additional operation-specific parameters

Returns:

Processed JSON data

Calculator Tool

class grami_ai.tools.base_tools.CalculatorTool[source]

Bases: BaseTool

A specialized async calculator tool for mathematical operations.

Supports basic arithmetic operations with comprehensive error handling and logging.

Inherits all attributes from BaseTool.
async run(operation: str, a: int | float, b: int | float) → int | float[source]

Perform a mathematical operation asynchronously.

Parameters:

  • operation (str) – Mathematical operation to perform. Supported: ‘add’, ‘subtract’, ‘multiply’, ‘divide’

  • a (Union[int, float]) – First operand.

  • b (Union[int, float]) – Second operand.

Returns:

Result of the calculation.

Return type:

Union[int, float]

Raises:

ValueError – For invalid operations or division by zero.

async validate_input(operation: str, a: int | float, b: int | float) → bool[source]

Validate calculator input parameters.

Parameters:

  • operation (str) – Mathematical operation.

  • a (Union[int, float]) – First operand.

  • b (Union[int, float]) – Second operand.

Returns:

True if inputs are valid, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool
